document_metadata.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Treatment with the pan-HDAC inhibitor SAHA led to a marked increase in the level of Ac-Lys49 β-catenin (Figure 2A).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Treatment with the pan-HDAC inhibitor SAHA led to a marked increase in the level of Ac-Lys49 β-catenin (Figure 2A).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: These results suggest that Lys49 acetylation increases the ability of CK1α to bind and phosphorylate Ser45 on β-catenin while preventing GSK3β from phosphorylating its target sites Ser33, Ser37, and Thr41.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Our results show that Lys49 acetylation is accompanied by both increased CK1α and GSK3β binding, even though only CK1α is able to phosphorylate its target residue (Figure 3E).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Our results show that Lys49 acetylation is accompanied by both increased CK1α and GSK3β binding, even though only CK1α is able to phosphorylate its target residue (Figure 3E).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: While overall levels of β- catenin bound to N-cadherin did not appear to change in NPCs treated with ACY-1215, the pool of β-catenin bound to Ncadherin was enriched for Lys49 acetylation (Figure 5D).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: We show here that increased β-catenin Lys49 acetylation in human neuronal cells correlates with an increased localization of β-catenin at the plasma membrane.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Upon HDAC6 inhibition, Ac- Lys49 β-catenin levels increased in NPCs, which was accompanied by increased membrane localization of β-catenin.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Our results in the human NPCs are supportive of this latter model as HDAC6 inhibition-induced increase in Lys49 acetylation was accompanied by increase in Ser45 phosphorylation but increased Ser45 phosphorylation was not accompanied by increased phosphorylation of Ser33, Ser37, and Thr41.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: We show here that increased β-catenin Lys49 acetylation in human neuronal cells correlates with an increased localization of β-catenin at the plasma membrane.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: We observed similar results with crebinostat, which inhibits HDACs 1, 2, 3, and 6.[31]

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: While HDAC6 inhibitors increased levels of Ac-Lys49 β- catenin, there was no change in overall levels of β-catenin in the NPCs (Figure 2).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: In the presence of HDAC6 knockdown, we again observed an increase in Lys49 acetylation and Ser45 phosphorylation.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: In the human NPCs we studied, Ac-Lys49 levels were undetectable at baseline, and there was no noticeable β-catenin staining in the nucleus suggesting that either p300/CBP acetylase activity is low or HDAC6 activity is high in NPCs relative to the cancer cell lines.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Our results in the human NPCs are supportive of this latter model as HDAC6 inhibition-induced increase in Lys49 acetylation was accompanied by increase in Ser45 phosphorylation but increased Ser45 phosphorylation was not accompanied by increased phosphorylation of Ser33, Ser37, and Thr41.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: While HDAC6 inhibitors increased levels of Ac-Lys49 β- catenin, there was no change in overall levels of β-catenin in the NPCs (Figure 2).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: Using immunofluorescence, we found that both ACY-1215 and siRNA knockdown of HDAC6 induced pronounced increases in β-catenin at the plasma membrane (Figure 5A, B).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: In the human NPCs we studied, Ac-Lys49 levels were undetectable at baseline, and there was no noticeable β-catenin staining in the nucleus suggesting that either p300/CBP acetylase activity is low or HDAC6 activity is high in NPCs relative to the cancer cell lines.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: In the presence of HDAC6 knockdown, we again observed an increase in Lys49 acetylation and Ser45 phosphorylation.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: In the presence of the HDAC6 inhibitor ACY-1215, the increased levels of Ac-Lys49 β-catenin had no effect on the levels for β-catenin phosphorylated at Ser33, Ser37, and Thr41 (Figure 3A, B).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: In the presence of the HDAC6 inhibitor ACY-1215, the increased levels of Ac-Lys49 β-catenin had no effect on the levels for β-catenin phosphorylated at Ser33, Ser37, and Thr41 (Figure 3A, B).

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: We also found that HDAC6 inhibitor-mediated increase in Lys49 acetylation and Ser45 phosphorylation led to decreased ubiquitination in the presence of proteasomal inhibition.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.

links.evidence: We also found that HDAC6 inhibitor-mediated increase in Lys49 acetylation and Ser45 phosphorylation led to decreased ubiquitination in the presence of proteasomal inhibition.

citation.name: HDAC6 inhibitors modulate Lys49 acetylation and membrane localization of β-catenin in human iPSC-derived neuronal cells.
